== Create your first GWT project
=== Create project You can also create the GWT projects directory from the command line. Open a command shell (Start-> Run -> cmd on windows),switch to the GWT installation directory (cd c:\GWT) and run the following two commands.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="../examples/command/projectCreator[] ----
The final argument will be the full qualified class which will run the application.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="../examples/command/applicationCreator[] ----
=== Import project The created files can be imported to Eclipse. Also a example runtime configuration for Eclipse is created. Select File -> Import -> General -> Existing Project into Workspace.
image::helloworld10.gif[]
=== Run project Your project should have a launch configuration included. Select HelloGwt.launch, right-click on it and select Run as->HelloGwt
